intro: Leontodon umbellatus, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, basal rosette of leaves and a single, short stem bearing a small, yellow flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is often found in open habitats with moderate sunlight. Leontodon umbellatus is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
